column2: items$GRMStot <- sjstats::mean_n(items[, GRMSVars], .80)#will create the mean for each individual if 80% of variables are present
items$Objectified <- sjstats::mean_n(items[,ObjectifiedVars], .80)#will create the mean for each individual if 80% of variables are present
items$Marginalized <- sjstats::mean_n(items[,MarginalizedVars], .80)#will create the mean for each individual if 80% of variables are present
items$Strong <- sjstats::mean_n(items[,StrongVars], .80)#will create the mean for each individual if 80% of variables are present (in this case all variables must be present)
items$Angry <- sjstats::mean_n(items[,AngryVars], .80)#will create the mean for each individual if 80% of variables are present (in this case all variables must be present)
